intro: Tacsonia trinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined tacsonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with three main veins, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Tacsonia trinervia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
